pullRequest.body:
[Suggested](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11108#issuecomment-1975318101) by @loefflerd.
Only code motion (and cosmetic adaptions, such as minimising import and open statements).

Pre-requisite for #11108 and (morally) #11110.

-----------

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Here's a useful hack for fixing downstream imports when you've moved a lot of code around.

- Make a temporary file in mathlib which has no content, but imports all the other files you've changed in the refactor.
- Make every file elsewhere in mathlib which imported one of the changed files import your new temporary file.
- Let CI run on this, and then do `lake exe cache get` and `lake exe shake --fix`.

FWIW, I'm not sure if there's a standard convention about copyright / author declarations for newly-created files which are made up of code moved from elsewhere in a refactor, but I usually handle this by copying across the author names from the previous files.

Thanks for the suggestions. These are really helpful, going forward --- my current approach was a bit tedious.

The imports were basically already fixed, so I didn't need your approach this time. For the copyright, used git blame (on mathlib :-(, the history merge would have been useful) to find the main authors of the respective lemmas.

I have merged master, completed the module docstring and fixed the copyright. This is ready for review again.
awaiting-review
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

LGTM!
Looks great! I left a couple of minor comments on the file docstring.
LGTM!

```suggestion

```

(always give fully qualified names in the file-level summary). Please check the other lemma names too.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: move material about the Dominated Convergence Theorem into one file

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: continuity of the parametric set integral

Here's a useful hack for fixing downstream imports when you've moved a lot of code around.

- Make a temporary file in mathlib which has no content, but imports all the other files you've changed in the refactor.
- Make every file elsewhere in mathlib which imported one of the changed files import your new temporary file.
- Let CI run on this, and then do `lake exe cache get` and `lake exe shake --fix`.

FWIW, I'm not sure if there's a standard convention about copyright / author declarations for newly-created files which are made up of code moved from elsewhere in a refactor, but I usually handle this by copying across the author names from the previous files.

Thanks for the suggestions. These are really helpful, going forward --- my current approach was a bit tedious.

The imports were basically already fixed, so I didn't need your approach this time. For the copyright, used git blame (on mathlib :-(, the history merge would have been useful) to find the main authors of the respective lemmas.

I have merged master, completed the module docstring and fixed the copyright. This is ready for review again.
